answers.answer: I found out I had that with my first daughter when I was 35 weeks. I went to labor & delivery because of contractions and they told me I wasn't in labor but my blood pressure was too high. First they put me in bed rest for an hour and a half than they put me in the deli every room and induced me. It was too dangerous to go any further in the pregnancy. After I had my daughter my blood pressure was still high and they still had me on medicine to bring my bp down and I couldn't have my baby in my room alone. I had to have someone in the room with me until I got off the medicine and I was on a liquid dietbut in the end everything worked out good.
I had an extreme blood pressure at 29 weeks but no other signs they gave me the steroids just in case and now I'm 34 weeks pregnant. .!
@tyras11 didn't they put you on bed rest or anything and the you have weekly appointments

I just went thru this a week ago, I started having contractions at 32+6wks I got a shot to stop the contractions and the steroid shots for his lungs, I stayed in the hospital 3 more days to monitor and was switched to a pill to keep contractions at a minimum. I was sent home on bed rest orders for at least two weeks, I'm now 34+4wks and still pregnant!
@deaubrey Yea I go to the doctor twice a week and I am on bed rest yes ma'am..!!

question: Have any one experience preterm labor and having to take steroids for baby lunges. I'm 33 weeks and have been diagnosed with Mild preeclampsia . Currently in the hospital so she can be monitored. I will have to deliver early if needed. I'm due May 26. Has anyone else gone through this
title: preterm labor and steroids
